General.text:
Type:
opioid
Dosage Forms: PO, SC,IM,IV
Common Trade Names: Demerol

General_2.text:
Pain:
50-150mg PO/SC/IM/IV q3-4h: decrease dose if given IV. Seizure risk if dose > 600mg in 24 hours.

Pain:
50-150mg PO/SC/IM/IV q3-4h: decrease dose if given IV. Seizure risk if dose > 600mg in 24 hours.

Special_Populations.text:
Pregnancy Rating
: B
Lactation Risk Categories
: safe
Renal Dosing
Adult: CrCl 10-50: decrease dose 25%, if CrCl < 10: decrease dose 50%
Pediatric: CrCl 10-50: decrease dose 25%, if CrCl < 10: decrease dose 50%
Hepatic Dosing
Adult: not defined
Pediatric: not defined

Contraindications.text:
Allergy to class/drug
MAOI use within 14 days
Respiratory depression

Serious.text:
Respiratory Depression
Apnea
Hypotension
syncope
bradycardia
urinary retention
Seizures
anaphylaxis

Common.text:
Nausea
Rash
Headache
Fatigue
xerostomia
constipation
Tremor
urinary retention

Pharmacology.text:
Half-life: 3-5 hour
Metabolism: Liver
Excretion: urine
Mechanism of Action:binds to various opioid receptors
